item.title: Lori add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "The wrongs done to trees, wrongs of every sort, are done in the darkness of ignorance and unbelief, for when the light comes, the heart of the people is always right." -- John Muir

item.title: Lori add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The first thing I do in the morning is brush my teeth and sharpen my tongue." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "He that can have patience can have what he will." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Fear not death for the sooner we die, the longer we shall be immortal." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "You may delay, but time will not." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "I didn't fail the test, I just found 100 ways to do it wrong." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "How many observe Christ's birthday! How few, His precepts!" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by James Bovard
item.description: "Democracy must be something more than two wolves and a sheep voting on what to have for dinner." -- James Bovard

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Never ruin an apology with an excuse." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Hide not your talents, they for use were made, What's a sundial in the shade?" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Well done is better than well said." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "The Constitution only guarantees the American people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "If all printers were determined not to print anything till they were sure it would offend nobody, there would be very little printed." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Justice will not be served until those who are unaffected are as outraged as those who are." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Many people die at twenty five and aren't buried until they are seventy five." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Tis a great confidence in a friend to tell him your faults; greater to tell him his." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "It is the first responsibility of every citizen to question authority." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "I am for doing good to the poor, but...I think the best way of doing good to the poor, is not making them easy in poverty, but leading or driving them out of it. I observed...that the more public provisions were made for the poor, the less they provided for themselves, and of course became poorer. And, on the contrary, the less was done for them, the more they did for themselves, and became richer." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Be at war with your vices, at peace with your neighbors, and let every new year find you a better man." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Never confuse Motion with Action." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lori add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise." -- Benjamin Franklin
